metadata.title: CVE-2019-17016 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
When pasting a <style> tag from the clipboard into a rich texteditor, the CSS sanitizer incorrectly rewrites a @namespace rule. Thiscould allow for injection into certain types of websites resulting in dataexfiltration. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 68.4 and Firefox <72.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17016` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 72.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 72.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 72.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '72.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
